blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Generates user access token

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api key obtained from Dropbox

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Api secret obtained from Dropbox

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: Redirect uri set for your app

args.name: code
args.info: Code provided by user

blocks.name: revokeAccessToken
blocks.description: Revokes user access tokens

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token to revoke

blocks.name: getSingleUserAccount
blocks.description: Get information about a user's account.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: userId
args.info: ID of the user

blocks.name: getMe
blocks.description: Get information about a current user's account.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

blocks.name: getUserAccounts
blocks.description: Get information about a users' accounts.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: userIds
args.info: IDs of the users

blocks.name: getMySpaceUsage
blocks.description: Get the space usage information for the current user's account.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

blocks.name: copy
blocks.description: Copy a file or folder to a different location in the user's Dropbox. If the source path is a folder all its contents will be copied.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: fromPath
args.info: Path in the user's Dropbox to be copied

args.name: toPath
args.info: Path in the user's Dropbox that is the destination.

args.name: allowSharedFolder
args.info: If true, copy will copy contents in shared folder, otherwise RelocationError.cant_copy_shared_folder will be returned if from_path contains shared folder. This field is always true for move. The default for this field is False.

args.name: autoRename
args.info: If there's a conflict, have the Dropbox server try to autorename the file to avoid the conflict. The default for this field is False.

blocks.name: copyBatch
blocks.description: Copy multiple files or folders to different locations at once in the user's Dropbox.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: entries
args.info: List of entries to be copied. Example: [{"from_path":"/123/sample.json", "to_path": "/321/sample.json"}]

args.name: allowSharedFolder
args.info: If true, copy will copy contents in shared folder, otherwise RelocationError.cant_copy_shared_folder will be returned if from_path contains shared folder. This field is always true for move. The default for this field is False.

args.name: autoRename
args.info: If there's a conflict, have the Dropbox server try to autorename the file to avoid the conflict. The default for this field is False.

blocks.name: getCopyStatus
blocks.description: Returns the status of an asynchronous job for copyBatch. If success, it returns list of results for each entry.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: copyJobId
args.info: Id of the asynchronous job. This is the value of a response returned from the method that launched the job.

blocks.name: getCopyReference
blocks.description: Get a copy reference to a file or folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: path
args.info: The path to the file or folder you want to get a copy reference to.

blocks.name: saveCopyReference
blocks.description: Save a copy reference returned by getCopyReference to the user's Dropbox.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: destinationPath
args.info: Path in the user's Dropbox that is the destination.

args.name: copyReference
args.info: A copy reference returned by getCopyReference.

blocks.name: createFolder
blocks.description: Create a folder at a given path.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: folderPath
args.info: Path in the user's Dropbox to create.

args.name: autoRename
args.info: If there's a conflict, have the Dropbox server try to autorename the folder to avoid the conflict. The default for this field is False.

blocks.name: delete
blocks.description: Deletes a folder or a file at a given path.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: deletePath
args.info: Path in the user's Dropbox to delete.

blocks.name: deleteBatch
blocks.description: Delete multiple files/folders at once.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: deleteEntries
args.info: list of entries to delete. Exmaple: [{"path":"/125"}, {"path":"/126"}]

blocks.name: getDeleteStatus
blocks.description: Returns the status of an asynchronous job for deleteBatch. If success, it returns list of results for each entry.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: deleteJobId
args.info: Id of the asynchronous job. This is the value of a response returned from the method that launched the job.

blocks.name: downloadFile
blocks.description: Download a file from a user's Dropbox.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: filePath
args.info: Path of the file

blocks.name: getMetadata
blocks.description: Returns the metadata for a file or folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: path
args.info: Path of the file or a folder

args.name: includeMediaInfo
args.info: If true, FileMetadata.media_info is set for photo and video. The default for this field is False.

args.name: includeDeleted
args.info: If true, DeletedMetadata will be returned for deleted file or folder, otherwise LookupError.not_found will be returned. The default for this field is False.

args.name: includeHasExplicitSharedMembers
args.info: If true, the results will include a flag for each file indicating whether or not that file has any explicit members. The default for this field is False.

blocks.name: getFilePreview
blocks.description: Get a preview for a file. Currently previews are only generated for the files with the following extensions: .doc, .docx, .docm, .ppt, .pps, .ppsx, .ppsm, .pptx, .pptm, .xls, .xlsx, .xlsm, .rtf.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: filePath
args.info: Path of the file

blocks.name: getFileTemporaryLink
blocks.description: Get a temporary link to stream content of a file. This link will expire in four hours and afterwards you will get 410 Gone. Content-Type of the link is determined automatically by the file's mime type.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: filePath
args.info: Path of the file

blocks.name: getImageThumbnail
blocks.description: This method currently supports files with the following file extensions: jpg, jpeg, png, tiff, tif, gif and bmp. Photos that are larger than 20MB in size won't be converted to a thumbnail.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: imagePath
args.info: Path of the image

args.name: format
args.info: The format for the thumbnail image, jpeg (default) or png. For images that are photos, jpeg should be preferred, while png is better for screenshots and digital arts. The default for this union is jpeg.

args.name: size
args.info: The size for the thumbnail image. The default for this union is w64h64.

blocks.name: getFolderContents
blocks.description: Starts returning the contents of a folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: path
args.info: Path of the file or a folder

args.name: recursive
args.info: If true, the list folder operation will be applied recursively to all subfolders and the response will contain contents of all subfolders. The default for this field is False.

args.name: includeMediaInfo
args.info: If true, FileMetadata.media_info is set for photo and video. The default for this field is False.

args.name: includeDeleted
args.info: If true, DeletedMetadata will be returned for deleted file or folder, otherwise LookupError.not_found will be returned. The default for this field is False.

args.name: includeHasExplicitSharedMembers
args.info: If true, the results will include a flag for each file indicating whether or not that file has any explicit members. The default for this field is False.

blocks.name: paginateFolderContents
blocks.description: Once a cursor has been retrieved from getFolderContents, use this to paginate through all files and retrieve updates to the folder, following the same rules as documented for getFolderContents.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: cursor
args.info: The cursor returned by your last call to getFolderContents or paginateFolderContents

blocks.name: getLatestCursor
blocks.description: A way to quickly get a cursor for the folder's state.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: path
args.info: Path of the file or a folder

args.name: recursive
args.info: If true, the list folder operation will be applied recursively to all subfolders and the response will contain contents of all subfolders. The default for this field is False.

args.name: includeMediaInfo
args.info: If true, FileMetadata.media_info is set for photo and video. The default for this field is False.

args.name: includeDeleted
args.info: If true, DeletedMetadata will be returned for deleted file or folder, otherwise LookupError.not_found will be returned. The default for this field is False.

args.name: includeHasExplicitSharedMembers
args.info: If true, the results will include a flag for each file indicating whether or not that file has any explicit members. The default for this field is False.

blocks.name: getFileRevisions
blocks.description: Return revisions of a file.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: filePath
args.info: Path of the file

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of revision entries returned. The default for this field is 10.

blocks.name: move
blocks.description: Move a file or folder to a different location in the user's Dropbox. If the source path is a folder all its contents will be moved.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: fromPath
args.info: Path in the user's Dropbox to be moved

args.name: toPath
args.info: Path in the user's Dropbox that is the destination.

args.name: autoRename
args.info: If there's a conflict, have the Dropbox server try to autorename the file to avoid the conflict. The default for this field is False.

blocks.name: moveBatch
blocks.description: Move multiple files or folders to different locations at once in the user's Dropbox.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: entries
args.info: List of entries to be moved. Example: [{"from_path":"/123/sample.json", "to_path": "/321/sample.json"}]

args.name: autoRename
args.info: If there's a conflict, have the Dropbox server try to autorename the file to avoid the conflict. The default for this field is False.

blocks.name: getMoveStatus
blocks.description: Returns the status of an asynchronous job for moveBatch. If success, it returns list of results for each entry.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: moveJobId
args.info: Id of the asynchronous job. This is the value of a response returned from the method that launched the job.

blocks.name: restoreFileToRevision
blocks.description: Restore a file to a specific revision.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: filePath
args.info: Path of the file in the user's Dropbox to restore.

args.name: revisionId
args.info: Id of the revision

blocks.name: saveFileURL
blocks.description: Save a specified URL into a file in user's Dropbox. If the given path already exists, the file will be renamed to avoid the conflict (e.g. myfile (1).txt).

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: filePath
args.info: Path of the file in the user's Dropbox to restore.

args.name: url
args.info: The URL to be saved.

blocks.name: getSaveFileURLStatus
blocks.description: Returns the status of an asynchronous job for saveFileURL. If success, it returns list of results for each entry.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: saveUrlJobId
args.info: Id of the asynchronous job. This is the value of a response returned from the method that launched the job.

blocks.name: search
blocks.description: Searches for files and folders.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: searchPath
args.info: The path in the user's Dropbox to search. Should probably be a folder.

args.name: searchQuery
args.info: The string to search for. The search string is split on spaces into multiple tokens. For file name searching, the last token is used for prefix matching (i.e. "bat c" matches "bat cave" but not "batman car").

args.name: startFrom
args.info: The starting index within the search results (used for paging). The default for this field is 0.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: The maximum number of search results to return. The default for this field is 100.

args.name: searchMode
args.info: The search mode (filename, filename_and_content, or deleted_filename). Note that searching file content is only available for Dropbox Business accounts. The default for this union is filename.

blocks.name: uploadSingleFile
blocks.description: Create a new file with the contents provided in the request.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: filePath
args.info: Path in the user's Dropbox to save the file.

args.name: file
args.info: The file to upload

args.name: uploadMode
args.info: Selects what to do if the file already exists. The default for this union is add.

args.name: autoRename
args.info: If there's a conflict, as determined by mode, have the Dropbox server try to autorename the file to avoid conflict. The default for this field is False.

args.name: clientModified
args.info: Timestamp(format="%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ") The value to store as the client_modified timestamp.

args.name: mute
args.info: Normally, users are made aware of any file modifications in their Dropbox account via notifications in the client software. If true, this tells the clients that this modification shouldn't result in a user notification. The default for this field is False.

blocks.name: marksDocAsDeleted
blocks.description: Marks the given Paper doc as deleted. This operation is non-destructive and the doc can be revived by the owner.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: documentId
args.info: Id of the document

blocks.name: getDocs
blocks.description: Return the list of all Paper docs according to the argument specifications.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: filterBy
args.info: Allows user to specify how the Paper docs should be filtered. Possible values: docs_accessed(default), docs_created

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Allows user to specify how the Paper docs should be sorted. Possible values: accessed(default), modified, created

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: Allows user to specify the sort order of the result. Possible values: ascending(default), descending

args.name: limit
args.info: Size limit per batch. The maximum number of docs that can be retrieved per batch is 1000. Higher value results in invalid arguments error. The default for this field is 1000.

blocks.name: downloadDocAsHTML
blocks.description: Exports and downloads Paper doc either as HTML.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: documentId
args.info: Id of the document

blocks.name: downloadDocAsMarkdown
blocks.description: Exports and downloads Paper doc either as Markdown.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: documentId
args.info: Id of the document

blocks.name: getDocInvitedUsers
blocks.description: Lists the users who are explicitly invited to the Paper folder in which the Paper doc is contained. For private folders all users (including owner) shared on the folder are listed and for team folders all non-team users shared on the folder are returned.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: documentId
args.info: Id of the document

args.name: limit
args.info: Size limit per batch. The maximum number of users that can be retrieved per batch is 1000. Higher value results in invalid arguments error. The default for this field is 1000.

blocks.name: paginateDocInvitedUsers
blocks.description: Once a cursor has been retrieved from getDocInvitedUsers, use this to paginate through all users on the Paper folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: documentId
args.info: Id of the document

args.name: cursor
args.info: he cursor obtained from getDocInvitedUsers

blocks.name: getFolderInfo
blocks.description: Retrieves folder information for the given Paper doc.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: documentId
args.info: Id of the document

blocks.name: paginateDocs
blocks.description: Once a cursor has been retrieved from getDocs, use this to paginate through all Paper doc.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: cursor
args.info: The cursor obtained from getDocs

blocks.name: getDocSharingPolicy
blocks.description: Gets the default sharing policy for the given Paper doc.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: documentId
args.info: Id of the document

blocks.name: setDocSharingPolicy
blocks.description: Sets the default sharing policy for the given Paper doc.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: documentId
args.info: Id of the document

args.name: publicSharingPolicy
args.info: This value applies to the non-team members. Possible values: people_with_link_can_edit, people_with_link_can_view_and_comment, invite_only, disabled

args.name: teamSharingPolicy
args.info: This value applies to the team members. Possible values: people_with_link_can_edit, people_with_link_can_view_and_comment, invite_only

blocks.name: addUsersToDoc
blocks.description: Allows an owner or editor to add users to a Paper doc or change their permissions using their email or Dropbox account id.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: documentId
args.info: Id of the document

args.name: membersList
args.info: Users which should be added to the Paper doc. Specify only email or Dropbox account id. Example: [{"member": {".tag": "email","email": "justin@example.com"},"permission_level":{".tag":"view_and_comment"}}]

args.name: customMessage
args.info: A personal message that will be emailed to each successfully added member.

args.name: quiet
args.info: Clients should set this to true if no email shall be sent to added users. The default for this field is False.

blocks.name: getVisitedDocUsers
blocks.description: Lists all users who visited the Paper doc or users with explicit access. This call excludes users who have been removed.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: documentId
args.info: Id of the document

args.name: limit
args.info: Size limit per batch. The maximum number of users that can be retrieved per batch is 1000. Higher value results in invalid arguments error. The default for this field is 1000.

args.name: filterBy
args.info: Specify this attribute if you want to obtain users that have already accessed the Paper doc. Possible values: shared(default), visited

blocks.name: paginateVisitedUsersDoc
blocks.description: Once a cursor has been retrieved from getVisitedDocUsers, use this to paginate through all users on the Paper doc.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: documentId
args.info: Id of the document

args.name: cursor
args.info: The cursor obtained from getVisitedDocUsers

blocks.name: deleteUserFromDoc
blocks.description: Allows an owner or editor to remove users from a Paper doc using their email or Dropbox account id.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: documentId
args.info: Id of the document

args.name: memberTag
args.info: Includes different ways to identify a member of a shared folder. This datatype comes from an imported namespace originally defined in the sharing namespace. The value will be one of the following datatypes. New values may be introduced as our API evolves. Possible values: email, dropbox_id

args.name: memberIdentifier
args.info: Id of the user or email

blocks.name: deleteDoc
blocks.description: Permanently deletes the given Paper doc. This operation is final as the doc cannot be recovered.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: documentId
args.info: Id of the document

blocks.name: addFileMembers
blocks.description: Adds specified members to a file.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: fileId
args.info: Id of the file

args.name: membersList
args.info: Users which should be added to the Paper doc. Specify only email or Dropbox account id. Example: [{".tag": "email","email": "justin@example.com"}]

args.name: customMessage
args.info: A personal message that will be emailed to each successfully added member.

args.name: quiet
args.info: Clients should set this to true if no email shall be sent to added users. The default for this field is False.

args.name: addMessageAsComment
args.info: If the custom message should be added as a comment on the file. The default for this field is False.

args.name: accessLevel
args.info: AccessLevel union object, describing what access level we want to give new members. Possible values: viewer(default), owner, editor, viewer_no_comment.

blocks.name: addFolderMembers
blocks.description: Adds specified members to a folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: folderId
args.info: Id of the folder

args.name: membersList
args.info: Users which should be added to the Paper doc. Specify only email or Dropbox account id. Example: [{".tag": "email","email": "justin@example.com"}]

args.name: customMessage
args.info: A personal message that will be emailed to each successfully added member.

args.name: quiet
args.info: Clients should set this to true if no email shall be sent to added users. The default for this field is False.

blocks.name: getUserSharedFolders
blocks.description: Return the list of all shared folders the current user has access to.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of results to return per request. The default for this field is 1000.

args.name: actionsList
args.info: A list of `FolderAction`s corresponding to `FolderPermission`s that should appear in the response's SharedFolderMetadata.permissions field describing the actions the authenticated user can perform on the folder.

blocks.name: checkJobStatus
blocks.description: Returns the status of an asynchronous job.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: jobId
args.info: Id of the asynchronous job. This is the value of a response returned from the method that launched the job

blocks.name: createSharedLink
blocks.description: Create a shared link with custom settings.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: linkPath
args.info: The path to be shared by the shared link

args.name: requestedVisibility
args.info: The requested access for this shared link. Possible values: public, team_only

blocks.name: getSharedFileMetadata
blocks.description: Returns shared file metadata.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: fileId
args.info: The file to query.

args.name: options
args.info: A list of `FileAction`s corresponding to `FilePermission`s that should appear in the response's SharedFileMetadata.permissions field describing the actions the authenticated user can perform on the file.

blocks.name: getSharedFileMetadataBatch
blocks.description: Returns shared file metadata.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: fileIds
args.info: Files to query.

args.name: options
args.info: A list of `FileAction`s corresponding to `FilePermission`s that should appear in the response's SharedFileMetadata.permissions field describing the actions the authenticated user can perform on the file.

blocks.name: getSingleFolderMetadata
blocks.description: Returns shared folder metadata by its folder ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: folderId
args.info: The ID for the shared folder.

args.name: options
args.info: A list of `FolderAction`s corresponding to `FolderPermission`s that should appear in the response's SharedFolderMetadata.permissions field describing the actions the authenticated user can perform on the folder.

blocks.name: getSharedLinkFile
blocks.description: Download the shared link's file from a user's Dropbox.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: linkUrl
args.info: URL of the shared link.

args.name: path
args.info: If the shared link is to a folder, this parameter can be used to retrieve the metadata for a specific file or sub-folder in this folder. A relative path should be used.

args.name: linkPassword
args.info: If the shared link has a password, this parameter can be used.

blocks.name: getSharedLinkMetadata
blocks.description: Get the shared link's metadata.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: linkUrl
args.info: URL of the shared link.

args.name: path
args.info: If the shared link is to a folder, this parameter can be used to retrieve the metadata for a specific file or sub-folder in this folder. A relative path should be used.

args.name: linkPassword
args.info: If the shared link has a password, this parameter can be used.

blocks.name: getFileInvitedUsers
blocks.description: Use to obtain the members who have been invited to a file, both inherited and uninherited members.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: fileId
args.info: The file for which you want to see members.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of members to return max per query. Defaults to 100 if no limit is specified. The default for this field is 100.

args.name: actions
args.info: The actions for which to return permissions on a member.

args.name: includeInherited
args.info: Whether to include members who only have access from a parent shared folder. The default for this field is True.

blocks.name: getFilesInvitedUsers
blocks.description: Get members of multiple files at once. The arguments to this route are more limited, and the limit on query result size per file is more strict.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: fileIds
args.info: Files for which you want to see members.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of members to return max per query. Defaults to 10 if no limit is specified.

blocks.name: paginateFileInvitedUsers
blocks.description: Once a cursor has been retrieved from getFileInvitedUsers or getFilesInvitedUsers, use this to paginate through all shared file members.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: cursor
args.info: The cursor returned by your last call

blocks.name: getSharedFolderMembers
blocks.description: Returns shared folder membership by its folder ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: folderId
args.info: The folder for which you want to see members.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of members to return max per query. The default for this field is 1000.

args.name: actions
args.info: The actions for which to return permissions on a member.

blocks.name: paginateSharedFolderMembers
blocks.description: Once a cursor has been retrieved from getSharedFolderMembers, use this to paginate through all shared folder members.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: cursor
args.info: The cursor returned by your last call

blocks.name: paginateUserSharedFolders
blocks.description: Once a cursor has been retrieved from getUserSharedFolders, use this to paginate through all shared folders.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: cursor
args.info: The cursor returned by your last call

blocks.name: getUserMountableFolders
blocks.description: Return the list of all shared folders the current user can mount or unmount.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of members to return max per query. The default for this field is 1000.

args.name: actions
args.info: A list of `FolderAction`s corresponding to `FolderPermission`s that should appear in the response's SharedFolderMetadata.permissions field describing the actions the authenticated user can perform on the folder.

blocks.name: paginateUserMountableFolders
blocks.description: Once a cursor has been retrieved from getUserMountableFolders, use this to paginate through all mountable folders.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: cursor
args.info: The cursor returned by your last call

blocks.name: getUserSharedFiles
blocks.description: Returns a list of all files shared with current user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of members to return max per query. The default for this field is 100.

args.name: actions
args.info: A list of `FileAction`s corresponding to `FilePermission`s that should appear in the response's SharedFileMetadata.permissions field describing the actions the authenticated user can perform on the file.

blocks.name: paginateUserSharedFiles
blocks.description: Get more results with a cursor from getUserSharedFiles

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: cursor
args.info: The cursor returned by your last call

blocks.name: updateSharedLinkSettings
blocks.description: Create a shared link with custom settings.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: linkUrl
args.info: URL of the shared link to change its settings

args.name: requestedVisibility
args.info: The requested access for this shared link. Possible values: public, team_only

blocks.name: relinquishFileMembership
blocks.description: The current user relinquishes their membership in the designated file. Note that the current user may still have inherited access to this file through the parent folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: fileId
args.info: ID of the file

blocks.name: relinquishFolderMembership
blocks.description: The current user relinquishes their membership in the designated folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: folderId
args.info: ID of the folder

args.name: leaveCopy
args.info: Keep a copy of the folder's contents upon relinquishing membership. The default for this field is False.

blocks.name: shareFolder
blocks.description: Share a folder with collaborators.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: folderPath
args.info: The path to the folder to share. If it does not exist, then a new one is created.

args.name: memberPolicy
args.info: Who can be a member of this shared folder. Only applicable if the current user is on a team. Possible values: team, anyone

args.name: aclUpdatePolicy
args.info: Who can add and remove members of this shared folder.  Possible values: owner, editors

args.name: sharedLinkPolicy
args.info: The policy to apply to shared links created for content inside this shared folder. The current user must be on a team to set this policy to SharedLinkPolicy.members. Possible values: anyone, team, members

args.name: forceAsync
args.info: Whether to force the share to happen asynchronously. The default for this field is False.

args.name: actions
args.info: A list of `FolderAction`s corresponding to `FolderPermission`s that should appear in the response's SharedFolderMetadata.permissions field describing the actions the authenticated user can perform on the folder.

args.name: accessLevel
args.info: The access level on the link for this file. Currently, it only accepts 'viewer' and 'viewer_no_comment'.

args.name: linkAudience
args.info: The type of audience on the link for this file. Possible values: public, team, members

args.name: linkExpiry
args.info: An expiry timestamp to set on a link. Possible values: remove_expiry, set_expiry Timestamp(format="%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ") Set a new expiry or change an existing expiry.

args.name: linkPassword
args.info: The password for the link. Possible values: remove_password, set_password

args.name: viewerInfoPolicy
args.info: Who can enable/disable viewer info for this shared folder.Possible values: enabled, disabled

blocks.name: checkShareJobStatus
blocks.description: Returns the status of an asynchronous job for sharing a folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: shareJobId
args.info: ID of the share job

blocks.name: unshareFolder
blocks.description: Allows a shared folder owner to unshare the folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: folderId
args.info: ID of the folder

args.name: leaveCopy
args.info: Keep a copy of the folder's contents upon relinquishing membership. The default for this field is False.

blocks.name: unshareFile
blocks.description: Remove all members from this file. Does not remove inherited members.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: fileId
args.info: ID of the file

blocks.name: mountFolder
blocks.description: The current user mounts the designated folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: folderId
args.info: ID of the folder

blocks.name: unmountFolder
blocks.description: The current user unmounts the designated folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: folderId
args.info: ID of the folder

blocks.name: revokeSharedLink
blocks.description: Revoke a shared link.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: linkUrl
args.info: URL of the shared link.

blocks.name: removeFileMember
blocks.description: Removes a specified member from the file.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: fileId
args.info: Id of the file

args.name: member
args.info: Member to remove from this file. Note that even if an email is specified, it may result in the removal of a user (not an invitee) if the user's main account corresponds to that email address. Example: {".tag": "email","email": "justin@example.com"}

blocks.name: removeFolderMember
blocks.description: Removes a specified member from the folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: folderId
args.info: Id of the file

args.name: member
args.info: Member to remove from this file. Note that even if an email is specified, it may result in the removal of a user (not an invitee) if the user's main account corresponds to that email address. Example: {".tag": "email","email": "justin@example.com"}

args.name: leaveCopy
args.info: If true, the removed user will keep their copy of the folder after it's unshared, assuming it was mounted. Otherwise, it will be removed from their Dropbox. Also, this must be set to false when kicking a group.

blocks.name: checkRemoveMemberStatus
blocks.description: Returns the status of an asynchronous job.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: removeJobId
args.info: Id of the asynchronous job. This is the value of a response returned from the method that launched the job

blocks.name: transferFolderOwnership
blocks.description: Transfer ownership of a shared folder to a member of the shared folder.User must have AccessLevel.owner access to the shared folder to perform a transfer.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: folderId
args.info: ID of the folder

args.name: userId
args.info: ID of the user

blocks.name: updateFileMemberAccess
blocks.description: Changes a member's access on a shared file.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: fileId
args.info: Id of the file

args.name: memberId
args.info: Dropbox ID of the user

args.name: accessLevel
args.info: Defines the access levels for collaborators. Currently only available: viewer

blocks.name: updateFolderMemberAccess
blocks.description: Changes a member's access on a shared folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: folderId
args.info: Id of the folder

args.name: member
args.info: Member to remove from this file. Note that even if an email is specified, it may result in the removal of a user (not an invitee) if the user's main account corresponds to that email address. Example: {".tag": "email","email": "justin@example.com"}

args.name: accessLevel
args.info: Defines the access levels for collaborators. Currently only available: viewer, editor

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token

args.name: folderId
args.info: The ID of the folder

args.name: memberPolicy
args.info: Who can be a member of this shared folder. Only applicable if the current user is on a team. Possible values: team, anyone

args.name: aclUpdatePolicy
args.info: Who can add and remove members of this shared folder.  Possible values: owner, editors

args.name: sharedLinkPolicy
args.info: The policy to apply to shared links created for content inside this shared folder. The current user must be on a team to set this policy to SharedLinkPolicy.members. Possible values: anyone, team, members

args.name: forceAsync
args.info: Whether to force the share to happen asynchronously. The default for this field is False.

args.name: actions
args.info: A list of `FolderAction`s corresponding to `FolderPermission`s that should appear in the response's SharedFolderMetadata.permissions field describing the actions the authenticated user can perform on the folder.

args.name: accessLevel
args.info: The access level on the link for this file. Currently, it only accepts 'viewer' and 'viewer_no_comment'.

args.name: linkAudience
args.info: The type of audience on the link for this file. Possible values: public, team, members

args.name: linkExpiry
args.info: An expiry timestamp to set on a link. Possible values: remove_expiry, set_expiry Timestamp(format="%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ") Set a new expiry or change an existing expiry.

args.name: linkPassword
args.info: The password for the link. Possible values: remove_password, set_password

args.name: viewerInfoPolicy
args.info: Who can enable/disable viewer info for this shared folder.Possible values: enabled, disabled
